ci_support_linux_.yaml:
build_number_decrement:
- '0'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge,defaults
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- condaforge/linux-anvil-comp7
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- '2.7'

about.description:
This is a wrapper around the NVML library.
For information about the NVML library, see the NVML developer page
http://developer.nvidia.com/nvidia-management-library-nvml
about.summary: Provides a Python interface to GPU management and monitoring functions.

about.description:
This is a wrapper around the NVML library.
For information about the NVML library, see the NVML developer page
http://developer.nvidia.com/nvidia-management-library-nvml
about.summary: Provides a Python interface to GPU management and monitoring functions.

name: nvidia-ml
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "nvidia-ml" %}
{% set pypi_name = "nvidia-ml-py3" %}
{% set version = "7.352.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ pypi_name }}/{{ pypi_name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 390f02919ee9d73fe63a98c73101061a6b37fa694a793abf56673320f1f51277

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv"

requirements:
  host:
    - python
    - pip
  run:
    - python

test:
  imports:
    - pynvml

about:
  home: https://github.com/nicolargo/nvidia-ml-py3
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'Provides a Python interface to GPU management and monitoring functions.'

  # The remaining entries in this section are optional, but recommended
  description: |
    This is a wrapper around the NVML library.
    For information about the NVML library, see the NVML developer page
    http://developer.nvidia.com/nvidia-management-library-nvml
  doc_url: https://github.com/nicolargo/nvidia-ml-py3
  dev_url: https://github.com/nicolargo/nvidia-ml-py3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - hadim
